main event: An unidentified flying object was observed by two military personnel in Kansas in 1961.
interesting points: The object was round in shape and the size of a quarter held at arm's length.
The object changed color from white or blue-green to red just before it burned out.
The object made rapid, darting motions up and down before disappearing and reappearing at a different angle.
The object was observed for 10-12 seconds and was reported to resemble a large flare.
The observers were considered completely reliable military personnel.
witnesses: J.D. Bourgeois, SSGT, and Leo Hackworth, A/2C
photographs: No photographs were included in the report.
